juzs.text: And We did not send down against his people after him a host from heaven, nor do We send (such a thing)
It was only one shout and then they all were dead silent
Alas for the mankind! Whenever a Messenger came to them, they used to mock at him
Don’t they see how many generations We have destroyed before them who will not return to them
And surely, all of them will be brought before Us
And the dead land is a sign for them. We give it life and brings forth grain from it so that they eat from there
And We produces in it gardens of date-palms and grapes, and We cause springs of water to gush forth from it
so that they may eat the fruits thereof. Their hands did not make it. Should they not give thanks
Glory be to Him Who has created all things in pairs which the earth produces, as well as their own (human) kind, and other things which they don’t know
And a sign for them is the night, when We withdraw the daylight from it, and behold, they are in darkness
And the sun runs on its fixed course for a term (appointed) for it. That is the Decree of the All-Mighty, the All-Knower
And the moon, We have measured its positions (phases) for it till it returns like the old dried curved date stalk
The sun is neither permitted to overtake the moon nor does the night outstrip the day. They all each float in its own orbit
And a sign for them is that We carried their offspring in the laden ship (of Noah)
And We have created for them similar (vessels) on which they ride
And if We will, We can drown them, and there will be no helper for them, nor will they be saved
except through the Mercy from Us and as an enjoyment for a while
And when it is said to them: “Beware of that which is before you (worldly punishments) and that which is behind you (punishments in the Hereafter) so that you may receive Mercy.”
And whenever a sign of the Verses of their Lord comes to them, they turn away from it

Whenever it is said to them:“Spend out of what Allah has provided you.” Those who disbelieve say to those who believe: “Should we feed those whom, if Allah wills, He (Himself) can feed? You are in plain error.”
And they say: “When will this Promise (Resurrection) be fulfilled if you are truthful?”
They are waiting for a single shout, which will seize them while they are disputing (among themselves)
Then, they will neither be able to make a will, nor they will be able to return to their family
And the trumpet will be blown in and behold! They will come out quickly from the graves to their Lord
They will say: “Woe to us! Who has raised us up from our place of sleep?” (It will be said to them): “This is what the Gracious (Allah) had promised and the Messengers spoke the truth!”
It will only be a single shout, so behold! They all will be brought up before Us
This Day (of Resurrection), no soul will be wronged in anything and you will be rewarded for your deeds
Surely, on that Day, the residents of the Paradise will be busy in joyful things
they and their wives will be in pleasant shade reclining on thrones
They will have all kinds of fruits in it and they will get whatever they ask for
(it will be said to them): “Peace,” a Word from the Lord, Merciful
(It will be said to sinners): “You get apart this Day, you criminals (from the believers)
O Children of Adam! Did I not command you that you should not worship Satan? Surely, he is a plain enemy to you
and you should worship Me. That is the Right Way
And indeed he (Satan) has led a great number of you astray. Didn’t you understand
This is hell which you were warned
Now burn in it this Day for what you used to disbelieve.”
This Day, We shall seal up their mouths, their hands will speak to Us, and their legs will bear witness to what they used to earn
And (if it had been) Our will, We could surely have wiped out (blinded) over their eyes so that they would struggle for the way, how then could they see
And if it had been Our will, We could have transformed them (into animals or lifeless objects) in their places. Then neither they could have been able to go forward nor they could have turned back
And those to whom We grant long life, We reverse them in creation (weakness after strength). Will they not then understand
And We have not taught him (Muhammad) poetry, nor is it suitable for him. This is only a reminder and a plain Qur’an
to warn those who are living and to establish the charge against the disbelievers
Don’t they see that We have created for them of what Our Hands have fashioned the cattle, which are under their dominion
And We have subdued them (animals) to them so that they have some of them for riding and some of them they eat
and there are other benefits in them and drinks (milk) for them. Should they not then be grateful
Yet, they have taken others (worthy of worship) besides Allah hoping to get their help
They cannot help them, yet, they will be brought forward as troops against those who worshipped them (at the time of Reckoning)
So let not their speech grieves you (O Muhammad). Surely, We know what they conceal and what they reveal
Don’t people see that We have created them from a sperm? Yet, they (stands up) as open opponent
And they put an example for Us and forget their own creations. He says: “Who will give life to these bones when they have rotten away and became dust?”
Say (O Muhammad): “He Who has created them for the first time, will give life to them again! And He is the All-Knower of every creation!”
It is He Who produces for you fire from the green tree, then behold, you kindle fire therewith
Is not He Who has created the heavens and the earth, able to create the like of them? Yes, indeed! He knows everything, supreme Creator
Surely, when He intends a thing, it is only that He says: “Be!” and it is
So glory be to Him in Whose hands (authority) is the dominion of every thing, and to Him you shall be returned
By those (angels) arranged in rows
by those (angels) who are strong in repelling (evil)
by those (angels) who bring the book (the Qur’an)
surely your one worthy of worship is indeed One (Allah)
the Lord of the heavens and the earth, and all that lies between them, and Lord of every point of the sun’s risings
Surely! We have adorned the lower heaven with beautiful stars
and has guarded against all rebellious devils
They cannot even listen to the higher group (angels) for they are pelted from every side
repulsed and they are under a constant punishment
Except such as snatch away something by stealing and they are pursued by a flaming fire of piercing brightness
Ask them (polytheists, O Muhammad): “Are they stronger as creation, or those whom We have created?” Surely, We created them of sticky clay
Nay, you (Muhammad) wonder while they mock (at you and the Qur’an)
When they are reminded, they don’t pay attention
and when they see a Verse (from Allah), they mock at it
and say: “This is nothing but clear magic
When we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we then surely be resurrected
Also our forefathers of old times?”
Say (O Muhammad): “Yes and you shall then be humiliated.”
It will be only a single shout and they will be staring
They will say: “Woe to us! This is the Day of recompense!”
(It will be said): “This is the Day of judgment which you used to deny.”
(It will be said to the angels): “Assemble those who did wrong, together with their companions whom they used to worship
besides Allah, and lead them to the way of flaming fire (hell).”
(When they will be gathered, Allah will say): “Stop them, surely they are to be questioned
What is the matter with you? Why don’t you help one another (as you used to do in the world)?”
Nay, but that Day they shall surrender
Some of them will face others to question one another
They will say (to their leaders): “Surely, you used to come to us from the right (with authority to beautify every evil, enjoin polytheism, and stop us from the truth).”
They will reply: “Nay, you were not believers
We had no authority over you. Nay! You were transgressing people
now the Word of our Lord has become justified against us, and indeed we shall taste (the punishment)
So we led you astray because we were ourselves astray.”
Then surely on that Day, they will share in the punishment
Certainly, that is how We shall deal with sinners
surely, when it was said to them: “There is no one worthy of worship but Allah,” they used to puff themselves up with pride
and say: “Are we going to abandon our one worthy of worship for the sake of a mad poet?”
Nay! He (Muhammad) has come with the truth and he has confirmed the (previous) Messengers
(It will be said): “Surely, you (polytheists) are going to taste the painful punishment
and you will be requited nothing except for what you had done (evil deeds).”
Except the chosen (faithful) devotees of Allah
those for them will have known provision
fruits, and they shall be honored
in the gardens of delight (Paradise)
on the thrones facing one another
served around (them) with a cup of pure wine
crystal-white, delicious to the drinkers
Neither they will have any kind of hurt, headache or sin in that, nor will they suffer intoxication from that
With them will be chaste females restraining their glances (for husbands only) with wide and beautiful eyes
as if they were preserved eggs
Some of them will turn to others, questioning each others
One of them will say: “Surely, I had a companion for me (in the world)
who used to say: ‘Are you among those who believe (in Resurrection after death)
When we die and become dust and bones, shall we indeed (be raised up) to receive reward or punishment (according to deeds)?”’
It will be said (to him): “Will you look down (to see the friend)?”
So the person looked down and saw friend in the midst of the fire
The person said: “By Allah! You have nearly ruined me
Had it not been for the Grace of my Lord, I would certainly have been among those brought forth (to hell)
(The believer in the heaven will say): “Are we then not to die (any more)
after our first death and we shall not be punished?”
Truly, this is the supreme success
For such an end, let everyone strive who wishes to strive
Is this (Paradise) a better entertainment or the tree of the Zaqqum (a horrible tree in hell)
Truly, We have made it a trail for the wrongdoers
Surely, it is a tree that grows in the bottom of hellfire
the shoots of its fruit-stalks are like the heads of devils
so truly, they will eat from it and fill their bellies from it
Then surely, on top of that, they will be given a mixture of boiling water (to drink)
Then surely, their return is to the flaming fire of hell
In fact, they found their fathers on the wrong way
so they are too haste to follow their footsteps
and indeed most of the ancient people went astray before them
and indeed We had sent warners (Messengers) among them
Then see how was the end of those who were warned (all perished)
except the chosen (faithful) devotees of Allah
And indeed Noah prayed to Us, and indeed We are the Best to answer (the prayer)
And We rescued him and his family from the great distress (drowning)
and made his progeny to be the only survivors
and left for him (a good name) among generations to come in later times
Peace be upon Noah (from Us) among the (people of) worlds
Surely, thus We reward the righteous people
Surely, he (Noah) was one of Our believing devotees
Then We drowned the others (disbelievers)
Surely, among those who followed his (Noah’s) way was Abraham
when he came to his Lord with a pure heart
When he said to his father and to his people: “What is it you worship
Is it a falsehood worthy of worship other than Allah that you seek
Then what do you think about the Lord of the worlds?”
Then he looked a glance at the stars
and said: “Surely, I am sick (he did this trick to stay in their temple of idols to destroy them and not to accompany them to the pagan’s feast).”
So they turned away from him, and departed
Then he turned to their idols and said: “Why don’t you eat (from food offered)
What is the matter with you that you don’t speak?”
Then he turned upon them, striking with his right hand
They (idol worshippers) came running towards him
He said: ”Do you worship what you carve
while Allah has created you and what you have make?”
They said: “Build for him a building (like a furnace) and throw him into the blazing fire!”
So they plotted against him, but We made them the lowest (humiliated)
He said (after his rescue from fire): “Surely, I am going to my Lord. He will guide me
My Lord! Grant me (offspring) from the righteous.”
So We gave him the glad tidings of a gentle boy

When he (son) was old enough to walk with him, he said: “O my son! Surely, I have seen in the sleep (dream) that I am slaughtering you (sacrifice to Allah), so what do you think!” He said: “O my father! Do what you are commanded (by Allah), you shall find me of the patient.”
Then, when they had both submitted themselves (to Allah), and he laid his son prostrate on his forehead (for sacrifice)
and Allah called out to him: “O Abraham
Surely, you have fulfilled the dream!” Surely! Thus We reward the righteous people
Surely, that was indeed a clear trial
We ransomed his son for a great sacrifice
and We left for him (good name) among the later generations (to come)
Peace be upon Abraham
Thus indeed We reward the righteous people
Surely, he was one of Our believing devotees
And We gave him the glad tidings of (his son) Isaac, a prophet from the righteous
We blessed him and Isaac. Of their progeny, there are some who do right, and some plainly wrong themselves
Indeed We gave Our Grace to Moses and Aaron
We saved them and their people from the great distress
and helped them, so they became victorious
We gave them the clear Scripture (Torah)
and guided them to the Right Way
We left for them (a good name) among later generations (to come)
Peace be upon Moses and Aaron
Surely, thus We do reward the righteous people
Surely! They were of Our believing devotees
Surely, Elias was one of the Messengers
When he said to his people: “Will you not fear (Allah)
Will you call upon Bal (idol) and forsake the best of creators
Allah, your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers?”
But they denied him (Elias), so they will certainly be brought forth (to the punishment)
except the chosen (faithful) devotees of Allah
We left for him (a good name) among later generations (to come)
Peace be upon Elias
Surely, thus We reward the righteous people
Surely, he was one of Our believing devotees
Surely, Lot was one of the Messengers
When We saved him and all his family
except an old woman (who was) among those who remained behind
then We destroyed the rest (the towns of Sodom at the Dead Sea in Jordan)
Surely, you pass by them in the morning
and at night; will you not then reflect (think)
Surely, Jonah was one of the Messengers
When he ran to the laden ship
he (agreed to) cast lots, and he was among the losers
Then a (big) fish swallowed him while he had done an act worthy of blame
Had it not been that he was of those who glorify (Allah)
he would have indeed remained in its belly (the fish) till the Day of Resurrection
Then We cast him out on the naked shore while he was sick
and We caused a plant of gourd (squash) to grow over him
Then We had sent him to a nation of 100,000 people or even more
They believed; so We gave them enjoyment for a while
Now ask them (disbelievers, O Muhammad): (Does it make sense that) your Lord should have only daughters while they choose to have sons
Or did We create the angels as females while they were witnesses
Surely, they invent a lie when they say
“Allah has begotten (children). Surely, they are liars!”
Has He chosen daughters (rather than) sons
What is the matter with you? How do you decide
Will you not then remember
Or is there any plain authority for you
Then bring your book if you are truthful
They have invented a kinship between Him and the jinns, but indeed the jinns know quite well that they will be brought for account (before Allah)
Glory be to Allah! (He is free) from what they attribute to Him
except the chosen (faithful) devotees of Allah
So, neither you nor those whom you worship (idols)
can lead (anyone) astray
except those who are destined to burn in hell
(The angels say): “There is one known place for us
Surely, we stand in rows (for prayers)
surely, we are those who glorify (Allah).”
Indeed they (disbelievers) used to say
“If we had a reminder like the people of old received (before the coming of Muhammad)
we would have indeed been the chosen devotees of Allah!”
But (since the Qur’an has come) they disbelieve in it (the Qur’an), and they will come to know (the consequence soon)
Surely, Our Word has gone forth for Our devotees, the Messengers
that surely they would be victorious
and verily, Our hosts (soldiers) will be victorious
So turn away (O Muhammad) from them for a while
and watch them, and they shall see (your victory)
Do they seek to hasten on Our Punishment
Then, when it descends into their court-yard (near them), then evil will be the morning for those who had been warned
So turn (O Muhammad) away from them for a while
and watch (their downfall) and they shall see (your victory)
Glory be to your Lord, the Lord of honor and power, (He is free) from what they attribute to Him
Peace be upon the Messengers
and all the praise be to Allah, Lord of the worlds
Sad. By the Qur’an full of reminding
Surely, those who disbelieve are in false pride and opposition
How many generations have We destroyed before them? They cried out when there was no longer time for escape
They wonder that a Warner (Muhammad) has come to them from among themselves! The disbelievers say: “This (Muhammad) is a sorcerer, a liar
Has he made all ones worthy of worship into one worthy of worship (Allah)? Surely, this is a strange thing!”
The leaders among them went about (saying): “Go on, and remain firm to your one worthy of worship! Surely, this is a thing designed (against you)
We have not heard like this in the religion of the Last days. This is nothing but an invention
Has the reminder been sent down to him alone from among us?” Nay! but they are in doubt about My Reminder (this Qur’an)! Nay, but they have not tasted (My) punishment
Or do they have the treasures of the Mercy of your Lord, the All-Mighty, the Real Bestower
Or is the dominion of the heavens and the earth for them and what is between them? If so, let them ascend up with their means
They will be like a defeated army of the confederates (who were defeated)
Before them the people of Noah, Ad, Pharaoh, and the people of stakes, denied (Messengers)
and Thamud, and the people of Lot, and the residents of the wood (Median); such were the confederates
each of them denied the Messengers, therefore My punishment was justified
These people wait nothing but only for a single shout; it has no pause of ending
They say: “Our Lord! Hasten to us our account (of deeds) before the Day of reckoning!”
Be patient (O Muhammad) on what they say, and remember Our servant David, gifted with power. Surely, he was often turning in repentance (toward Allah)
Surely, We made the mountains to glorify Our praises with him (David) in the evening and after sunrise
All the birds too assembled with him (David)
We made his kingdom strong and gave him wisdom and sound judgment in speech (decision)
Has the news of the 2 litigants (engaged in lawsuit) reached you when they climbed over the chamber (into his praying place)

When they entered in upon David, he was terrified of them. They said: “Don’t fear! We are 2 litigants; one of us has wronged on the other, therefore judge between us with truth, and not be unjust, and guide us to the Right Way
Surely, this is my brother (in religion), he has 99 ewes (female sheep), while I have only one ewe. Yet he says: ‘Hand it over to me, and he overpowered me in speech.’”

(David) said (without listening to the opponent): “He indeed has wronged you in demanding your ewe to his ewes. Surely, many partners oppress one on another, except those who believe and do righteous deeds, and they are few.” (While saying this) David realized that We have tested him, he sought forgiveness of his Lord, he fell down prostrate, and turned (to Allah) in repentance
So We forgave him. Surely, for him is a near access to Us and a good place of return (Paradise)

(Allah said): “O David! Surely! We have placed you as a vicegerent on the earth, so judge between people with justice and don’t follow your desire, for it will mislead you from the Way of Allah. Surely! Those who wander astray from the Way of Allah, they shall have a severe punishment, because they forgot the Day of Reckoning
And We did not create the heaven and the earth and all that is between them without purpose! That is the consideration of those who disbelieve! Then woe to those who disbelieve from the fire
Or should We treat those who believe and do righteous deeds like those who are mischief-makers on earth? Or should We treat the pious as criminals
This is a book (the Qur’an) which We have sent down to you (O Muhammad), full of blessings so that they may ponder over its Verses and men of understanding may learn
And We granted Solomon to David. How excellent a devotee! Surely, he was often turning in repentance (to Us)
When the well-trained horses of the highest breed (for Allah’s Cause) were displayed before him in one evening
and he said: “Surely I did love the good (of these horses) instead of remembering my Lord (in my Asr prayer),” till the time was over, and the sun had hidden in the veil (of night)
(then he said): “Bring them (horses) back to me.” Then he began to pass his hand over their legs and their necks (with affection)

And indeed, We did test Solomon and We placed on his throne a body (a devil, so he lost his kingdom for a while), then he did return (to Allah with repentance, and to his throne by the Grace of Allah)
He said: “My Lord! Forgive me, and bestow upon me a kingdom such as shall not be given to anyone after me. Surely, You are the Bestower.”
So, We (accepted his prayer and) subjected to him the wind, it blew gently to his order wherever he willed
and also the devils from the jinns with every kind of builder and diver
and also others bound in fetters
(Allah said to Solomon): “This is Our gift, so you spend or withhold, no account will be asked.”
Surely, he has a place of nearness to Us and will have a good final return (Paradise)
And remember Our devotee Job, when he invoked his Lord (saying): “Surely! Satan has afflicted me with distress (by losing my health) and suffering (by losing my wealth).”
(Allah said to him): “Strike (the ground) with your foot: This is (a spring of water) to wash in, cool and drink.”
And We gave him back his family, and the like thereof along with them as a Mercy from Us, and a reminder for those who understand

(Allah said): “Take a bundle of branches (thin grass) in your hand and strike with it (your wife to fulfill your oath of 100 strikes which was made during sickness), and don’t break your oath.” Truly! We found him patient. How excellent is the devotee! Surely, he was often turning in repentance (to Us)
And remember Our devotees, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, all owners of strength (in worship) and also of religious understanding
Surely, We chose them by granting them a good thing, the remembrance of the home (of Hereafter)
Surely, they are with Us, of those chosen and the best
Remember Ishmael, Elisha, and Isaiah, and all were among the best
This is a reminder (the Qur’an), and surely, for those pious people there is a good final return (Paradise)
The everlasting (Eden) gardens whose doors will be open for them
They will recline in it, they will call for fruits in abundance and drinks
and with them will be chaste females (virgins) restraining their glances (only for their husbands), equal in age
This is what you (the pious) are promised for the Day of reckoning
surely, this is Our Provision which will never finish
This is so! Surely for the transgressors, an evil will be return
hell! where they will burn, and worst is that place to rest
This is so! Then let them taste it, a boiling fluid and dirty wound discharges
and other (punishments) of similar kind, (all together) in pairs
(The misguided leaders will be told): “This is a troop entering with you (in hell), no welcome for them! Surely, they will burn in the fire!”
(The followers of the misguided leaders will say): “Nay, you too! No welcome for you! It is you (leaders) who brought this upon us. Such an evil is this place to stay in!”
They will say: “Our Lord! Those who brought this upon us, add to them double punishment in the fire!”
They will say (to each other): “What is the matter with us that we don’t see those people whom we used to count among the bad ones
Did we take them as an object of mockery, or our eyes failed to perceive them?”
Surely, that is the very truth: the people of the fire will have mutual dispute (common habit)
Say (O Muhammad): “I am only a Warner and there is no one worthy of worship except Allah, the One, the Irresistible
the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, the Mighty, the Forgiving.”
Say: “That (the Qur’an) is a great news
from which you turn away!”
(Say): “I had no knowledge of the exalted chiefs (angels) when they disputed (about the creation of Adam)
This is inspired to me with that I am only a plain Warner.”
(Remember) when your Lord said to the angels: “Surely, I am going to create a man from clay
so when I have fashioned him and breathed into him (his soul) from me, then you fall down to him and prostrate.”
So the angels prostrated, all of them together
except Satan, he was proud and was one of the disbelievers
(Allah) said: “O Satan! What prevents you from prostrating to one whom I have created with My own hands? Are you too proud or are you of the high exalted?”
(Satan) said: “I am better than he, You created me from fire, and You created him from clay.”
(Allah) said: “Then get out from here, for surely, you are accursed
and surely! My curse shall be on you till the Day of recompense.”
(Satan) said: “My Lord! Then give me respite till the Day is resurrected.”
(Allah) said: “Surely! You are of those allowed respite
till the Day of the time appointed.”
(Satan) said: “By Your might, I will surely mislead them all
except Your chosen (faithful) devotees amongst them.”
(Allah) said: “Then the truth, and the truth I say
that I will fill hell with you (Satan) and those of them (mankind) who follow you, all.”
Say (O Muhammad): “I ask you no wage for this (the Qur’an), nor am I one of the fakers (imposters)
It (this Qur’an) is nothing but a reminder for all (worlds)
and you shall certainly know its news after a while.”
The revelation of this book (the Qur’an) is from Allah, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise
Surely, We have sent down the book to you (O Muhammad) in truth. So worship Allah (alone) sincerely, the religion is for Allah

Surely, the religion is completely for Allah (alone). Those who take protectors besides Him (say): “We worship them only so that they may bring us near to Allah.” Surely, Allah will judge between them concerning that in which they differ. Truly, Allah does not guide the one who is a liar, and a disbeliever
Had Allah willed to take a son, He could have chosen anyone of those whom He has created and with whom He is pleased. But glory be to Him! Allah is the One, the Irresistible

He has created the heavens and the earth with the truth. He makes the night overtake the day and makes the day overtake the night. He has subjected the sun and the moon, each is running for an appointed term. Surely, He is the All-Mighty, the Forgiving

He has created you all from a single person (Adam); then made his wife (Eve) from him. He has sent down for you of cattle 8 in pairs. He creates you in the wombs of your mothers, creation after creation in 3 layers of darkness. Such is Allah, your Lord. The kingdom belongs to Him; there is no one worthy of worship but He. How can you then turn away

If you disbelieve, then surely (know that), Allah does not need you. He does not like disbelief from His servants. If you are grateful (believer), He is pleased with you. No bearer of burdens shall bear the burden of another. Then your return is to your Lord. So He will inform you what you did. Surely, He is the All-Knower of that which is in the hearts

And when some trouble touches people, they cry to their Lord, turning to Him in repentance. But when He bestows a Favor upon them from Him, they forget what they had supplicated (cried) to Him before, and they set up rivals to Allah in order to mislead others from His Way. Say: “Take pleasure in your disbelief for a while. Surely, you will be one of the inmates of the fire!”

Can the one who is obedient to Allah, prostrating or standing (in prayer) during the Hours of the night, fearing the Hereafter and hoping for the Mercy of the Lord (be compared with a disbeliever)? Say: “Are those who know equal to those who don’t know?” It is only people of understanding who will remember

Say (O Muhammad): “O My servants who believe, be afraid of your Lord and keep your duty (to Him). Good reward is for those who do good in this world, and Allah’s earth is spacious (if you cannot worship Allah at a place, then go to another)! Only those who are patient shall receive their rewards without reckoning.”
Say (O Muhammad): “Surely, I am commanded to worship Allah sincerely doing the religious deeds for Him
and I am commanded in order to be the first of those who submit themselves to Allah as Muslims.”
Say (O Muhammad): “Surely, if I disobey my Lord, I am afraid of the punishment of a great Day.”
Say (O Muhammad): “I worship by doing my religion sincerely for His sake.”
So worship what you like besides Him. Say (O Muhammad): “Surely, the losers are those who will lose themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection. Surely, that will be a clear loss!”
They shall have coverings of fire from above them and coverings (of fire) beneath them; so that with this Allah frightens His servants: “O My servants, therefore, fear Me!”
Those who avoid false deities by not worshipping them and turn to Allah in repentance, there are glad tidings for them. So announce (O Muhammad) the good news to My servants
those who listen to the Word (to worship Allah) and follow the best thereof. Such are the ones whom Allah has guided and such are the people of understanding
Is the one against whom the word of punishment is justified (equal to the one who avoids evil)? Can you rescue the one who is in the fire
But those who fear their Lord, for them lofty rooms are built one above another, with flowing rivers under them (Paradise). This is the Promise of Allah and Allah does not fail in (His) Promise

Don’t you see that Allah sends down water (rain) from the sky, and it penetrates in the earth and comes out as water-springs? Afterwards produces crops of different colors, then they wither and you see them turn yellow, and then He makes them dry and broken pieces. Surely, in this, there is a reminder for people of understanding

Is the one whose heart Allah has opened to Islam and is in light from its Lord (same as one who disbelieves)? So woe to those whose hearts are hardened against remembrance of Allah! They are in plain error

Allah has sent down the best statement, a book (this Qur’an), its parts resemble each other, often repeated. The skins of those who fear their Lord shiver from it. Then their skins and their hearts soften to the remembrance of Allah. Such is the guidance of Allah. He guides whom He pleases and whomever He sends astray, there is no guide for him
Is the one who will confront with the awful punishment on the Day of Resurrection (same as one who enters peacefully into Paradise)? It will be said to the wrongdoers: “Taste what you earned!”
Those who also denied before them, the punishment came on them from where they did not perceive
So Allah made them to taste the disgrace in the present life, but the punishment of the Hereafter is greater if they only knew
And indeed We have put forth every kind of example for mankind in this Qur’an in order that they may remember
It is an Arabic Qur’an without any crookedness (flaw) in it in order that they may avoid all evil

Allah puts forth an example: a captive belongs to many partners disputing with one another (like one who believes in many false deities), and a captive belongs entirely to one master (like one believes in one Allah). Are these 2 equal in comparison? All the praise be to Allah! But most of them don’t know
Surely, you (O Muhammad) will die and surely, they too will die
Then surely on the Day of Resurrection, you will dispute (to settle) before your Lord
